Description: Handle-plate sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater with part of handle; glaze firedred-brown; underside of plate and outer edge glazed; interior black with possible band in added red; top of plate: black-figure decoration consisting of acrobat; nude bearded male figure with fillet on head, performing back bend, legs to right, back contorted and face to the ground, supporting himself on his hands.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B102.16)
Payne 1931 / Necrocorinthia. A study of corinthian art in the archaic period (p. 117, no. 1180, fig. 42)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 104, no. A159)
Amyx 1988 / Corinthian Vase-Painting of the Archaic Period (p. 508, note 277)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 219, no. 47)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.042) (Phase 1)
